First aid information?: If in eyes, rinse slowly and gently with water for 15-20 minutes. If swallowed, sip a glass of water if able to swallow. Do not induce vomiting unless told by a poison control center or doctor. If on skin, rinse skin immediately with plenty of water for 15-20 minutes. If inhaled, move person to fresh air. If person is not breathing, call 911 or an ambulance, then give artificial respiration.
What special restrictions are placed on: This product is toxic to fish and wildlife. Do not discharge effluent containing this product into lakes, streams, ponds, estuaries, oceans, or other waters unless in accordance with the requirements of a National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System (NPDES) permit.
What PPE should I wear?: Wear goggles, safety glasses or face shield when handling. Avoid contact with skin. Do not breathe vapor or spray mist dust.
How does the product have to be stored o: Containers should be stored out of direct sunlight to maintain the product below its melting point. If product is exposed to sustained temperatures above 50°C, caking will occur with associated handling problems. Container should be kept dry and tightly closed.
Is this product banned in any region?: Not to be used in the State of California to preserve metalworking fluids or joint cements
